required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and PK Trial Evaluating the Plasma, Epithelial Lining Fluid, and Alveolar Macrophage Concentrations of Minocin IV
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Open-Label Trial Evaluating the Plasma, Epithelial Lining Fluid, and Alveolar Macrophage Concentrations of Intravenous Minocin (Minocylcine) for Injection

lead_sponsor.agency: Rempex Pharmaceuticals (a wholly owned subsidiary of The Medicines Company)

clinical_study.source: Rempex Pharmaceuticals (a wholly owned subsidiary of The Medicines Company)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1, safety and PK Open-Label trial evaluating the plasma, epithelial lining fluid, and alveolar macrophage concentrations of intravenous Minocin® (Minocycline) for injection in healthy adult subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety of Minocin IV and measure plasma, epithelial lining fluid, and alveolar macrophage drug levels after six doses of Minocin IV given 12 hours apart, administered as 1-hour infusions in healthy adult subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Analyze plasma, ELF and Alveolar Macrophage concentrations of minocycline
primary_outcome.description: Determine plasma ELF and Alveolar Macrophage concentrations of minocycline when administered to healthy adult subjects.

secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety and tolerability of Minocin IV when administered to healthy adult subjects by assessing adverse events, changes from baseline in physical examination findings, clinical safety laboratory test results, ECGs, and vital signs throughout the study.

intervention.description: Subjects will be assigned into 5 cohorts of 5 subjects each, who will receive six doses of Minocin IV every 12 hours, starting on Day 1. Each dose of Minocin IV will be administered as an IV infusion over 1 hour. Subjects will be assigned to cohort based on time of bronchoalveolar lavage.
